dfischer.utils

Class Lib

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.Lib

  • public class Lib
extends java.lang.Object
    Common library of basic methods used during the execution of a load test program.

      • getFormattedCurrentDateAndTime

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedCurrentDateAndTime(java.lang.String dateAndTimeFormat,
                                              int dayOffset,
                                              java.lang.String timeZone)
        Get the current date and time (plus an offset in days) as formatted text.
        Parameters:
        dateAndTimeFormat - the pattern describing the date and time format, see java.text.SimpleDateFormat
        dayOffset - the offset in days, counted from the current date. This can be a negative number (the past), or zero (today), or a positive number (the future)
        timeZone - the time zone in which the result should be calculated, as described in dfischer.utils.ZoneTime.timeZoneArray[n][1] (3-char-string)
        Returns:
        the current date and time (plus an offset in days) as formatted text.
        See Also:
        ZoneTime.timeZoneArray

      • getNaturalRandomNumberInRangeAsString

        public static java.lang.String getNaturalRandomNumberInRangeAsString(long startRange,
                                                     long endRange,
                                                     boolean fillLeadingZeros)
        Get a (natural) random number within a specified range as a text-string.
        Parameters:
        startRange - start range, must be equal or greater than zero
        endRange - end range, must be greater than start range
        fillLeadingZeros - if true = fill in leading zeros up to the length of the end range in order to get always a fixed length as result.
        Returns:
        a (natural) random number within a specified range as a text-string

      • binaryIndex

        public static int binaryIndex(byte[] buffer,
              int startPosition,
              byte[] searchPattern)
        Search inside a byte[] array the next occurrence of a search pattern.
        Parameters:
        buffer - examined byte[] array
        startPosition - offset inside the byte[] array from which one the pattern will be searched
        searchPattern - pattern to search
        Returns:
        the index inside the byte array where the first byte of the search pattern was found or -1 if the search pattern was not found.

      • binaryReplace

        public static byte[] binaryReplace(byte[] buffer,
                   byte[] searchPattern,
                   byte[] replacePattern,
                   int occurrencePosition)
        Search inside a byte array a binary pattern and replaces this pattern with a new one.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the byte array in which the binary pattern is searched and replaced.
        searchPattern - the binary pattern which is searched
        replacePattern - the new binary pattern which replaces the searched binary patter.
        occurrencePosition - the occurrence position of the pattern within the byte array (1 = first match, 2 = second match ... 0 = replace all patterns).
        Returns:
        the modified buffer which contains the replaced pattern(s) - or the unchanged buffer if no pattern was found at the specified occurrence position.

      • toAsciiString

        public static java.lang.String toAsciiString(java.lang.String s,
                             boolean preserveNL)
        Replaces all non ASCII chars (< 32 and > 126) of a string with "[dec numeric value]". As exception the dec values 9, 10 and 13 are converted to "\t", "\n" and "\r".
        Parameters:
        s - the string to convert
        preserveNL - if true, preserve the new line char after inserting "\n"
        Returns:
        a plain ASCII text string.

      • isAsciiContent

        public static boolean isAsciiContent(byte[] content)
        Checks if a byte[] array contains ASCII text data.
        Parameters:
        content - byte[] array to examine
        Returns:
        true, if the byte[] array contains ASCII text data

      • isAsciiContent

        public static boolean isAsciiContent(byte[] content,
                     int limitExaminationSize)
        Checks if a byte[] array contains ASCII text data - but limits the size of the examined data to save CPU.
        Parameters:
        content - byte[] array to examine
        limitExaminationSize - max. size to examine
        Returns:
        true, if the byte[] array contains ASCII text data

      • isUnicodeContent

        public static boolean isUnicodeContent(byte[] content,
                       int limitExaminationSize)
        Checks if a byte[] array contains Unicode text data - but limits the size of the examined data to save CPU.
        Parameters:
        content - byte[] array to examine
        Returns:
        true, if the byte[] array contains Unicode text data

      • toHtmlText

        public static java.lang.String toHtmlText(java.lang.String asciiText)
        Converts a text to the HTML format. Special characters like '<' and '>' are converted to their HTML representation.
        Parameters:
        asciiText - text to convert
        Returns:
        converted text in HTML format. Returns an empty string, if the input string is null.
        See Also:
        toHtmlAsciiText(java.lang.String, boolean)

      • toHtmlText

        public static java.lang.String toHtmlText(java.lang.String asciiText,
                          boolean replaceSpace)
        Converts a text to the HTML format. Special characters like '<' and '>' are converted to their HTML representation.
        Parameters:
        asciiText - text to convert
        replaceSpace - if true: replace white space ' ' with &nbsp;
        Returns:
        converted text in HTML format. Returns an empty string, if the input string is null.
        See Also:
        toHtmlAsciiText(java.lang.String, boolean)

      • toHtmlAsciiText

        public static java.lang.String toHtmlAsciiText(java.lang.String asciiText,
                               boolean replaceSpace)
        Converts a text to the ASCII-HTML format. All non printable characters and all characters with a decimal value greater than 126 are converted to dots ('.'). Special characters like '<' and '>' are converted to their HTML representation.
        Parameters:
        asciiText - text to convert
        replaceSpace - if true: replace white space ' ' with &nbsp;
        Returns:
        converted text in HTML format. Returns an empty string, if the input string is null.
        See Also:
        toHtmlText(java.lang.String)

      • htmlToUnicode

        public static java.lang.String htmlToUnicode(java.lang.String text)
        Converts a text which contain special chars in HTML format to the unicode format. Note: this method may consume much CPU time to process large strings and should not be used within a load test program.
         
        Examples:
        &nbsp; is converted to &#160;
        &gt; is converted to &#62;
        Parameters:
        text - text to convert
        Returns:
        converted text in unicode format

      • truncateString

        public static java.lang.String truncateString(java.lang.String s,
                              int truncLength,
                              java.lang.String truncTrailer)
        Truncates a string to a maximum length.
        Parameters:
        s - the input string
        truncLength - the maximum length
        truncTrailer - the trailer of the string if the string is truncated
        Returns:
        the input string itself if the string was not truncated or a truncated string if the input string was truncated.

      • replaceTextPattern

        public static java.lang.String replaceTextPattern(java.lang.String s,
                                  java.lang.String pattern,
                                  java.lang.String newValue,
                                  int occurrencePosition)
        Searches inside a string a text-pattern and replaces this pattern with a new value.
        Parameters:
        s - the string in which the text-pattern is searched and replaced.
        pattern - the text-pattern which is searched within the string.
        newValue - the value which replaces the pattern.
        occurrencePosition - the occurrence position of the pattern within the string (1 = first match, 2 = second match ... 0 = replace all patterns).
        Returns:
        the modified input string with the replaced pattern(s) - or the unchanged input string if no pattern was found at the specified occurrence position.

      • replaceJsonField

        public static java.lang.String replaceJsonField(java.lang.String jsonStr,
                                java.lang.String fieldName,
                                java.lang.String newValue)
        Searches inside a Json String and replaces the value.
        Parameters:
        jsonStr - the string representation of JSON Object.
        fieldName - the field in Json Object which needed to be updated.
        newValue - the value which replaces the pattern.
        Returns:
        the modified input string with the replaced pattern(s) - or the unchanged input string if no pattern was found at the specified occurrence position.

      • replaceJsonFieldPattern

        public static java.lang.String replaceJsonFieldPattern(java.lang.String jsonStr,
                                       java.lang.String fieldName,
                                       java.lang.String pattern,
                                       java.lang.String newValue,
                                       int occurrencePosition)
        Searches inside a Json String and replaces the pattern within a new value.
        Parameters:
        jsonStr - the string representation of JSON Object.
        fieldName - the field in Json Object which needed to be updated.
        pattern - the text-pattern which is searched within the string.
        occurrencePosition - the occurrence position of the pattern within the string (1 = first match, 2 = second match ... 0 = replace all patterns).
        Returns:
        the modified input string with the replaced pattern(s) - or the unchanged input string if no pattern was found at the specified occurrence position.

      • extractTextToken

        public static java.lang.String extractTextToken(java.lang.String text,
                                int tokenNr,
                                java.lang.String tokenDelimiterChars)
        Extracts a text-token from a string by splitting the string into fragments which are separated from each other by one ore more delimiter characters. This method does the same job as java.util.StringTokenizer but the first token has the number 1 (not 0).
        Parameters:
        text - input string from which the token will be extracted
        tokenNr - token number whose text will be extracted. The first token has the number 1
        tokenDelimiterChars - delimiters for separating tokens. Delimiter characters themselves will not be treated as tokens.
        Returns:
        text of extracted token or null if the token could not be extracted

      • trimString

        public static java.lang.String trimString(java.lang.String s)
        Removes white space from both ends of a string. This method does the same job as java.lang.String.trim() except that null is returned if the input string is null, instead of throwing a NullPointerException.
        Parameters:
        s - input string
        Returns:
        trimmed input string, or null if the input string is null

      • splitString

        public static java.lang.String[] splitString(java.lang.String s,
                             int fragementSize)
        Splits a string into string fragments.
        Parameters:
        s - string to split
        fragementSize - max. size of a single string fragment
        Returns:
        array of string fragments

      • splitByteArray

        public static byte[][] splitByteArray(byte[] b,
                      int fragementSize)
        Split a byte array into fragments of "byte arrays".
        Parameters:
        b - the byte array to split
        fragementSize - max. size of a single byte array fragment
        Returns:
        an array of "byte arrays"

      • filterString

        public static java.lang.String filterString(java.lang.String s,
                            java.lang.String leftSidedBoundaryText,
                            int leftSidedBoundaryMatchPosition,
                            java.lang.String rightSidedBoundaryText,
                            int rightSidedBoundaryMatchPosition)
        Extracts a text fragment that is enclosed by a left sided and a right sided boundary text.
        Parameters:
        s - input string
        leftSidedBoundaryText - left sided boundary text, "" (empty string) = start at first char of input string (ignore match postion)
        leftSidedBoundaryMatchPosition - 1 = first match position, 2 = second match position ... 0 = last match position
        rightSidedBoundaryText - right sided boundary text, "" (empty string) = end at last char of input string (ignore match postion)
        rightSidedBoundaryMatchPosition - 1 = first match position, 2 = second match position ... 0 = last match position
        Returns:
        extracted text fragment, or null if no match to a boundary text was found. Warning: the result may contain also an empty string.

        Returns the local host name (TCP/IP).
        Returns:
        the local host name, or an empty string if the host name can not be determined

      • getLocalHostIpAddress

        public static java.lang.String getLocalHostIpAddress()
        Get the most significant IP V4 address of the local host (TCP/IP). The most significant IP address is determined by the following order:
        1. First public IP V4 address
        2. First loopback IP V4 address
        Returns:
        the IP V4 address of the local host, or an empty string if the IP address can not be determined

      • getLocalHostIpAddress

        public static java.lang.String getLocalHostIpAddress(boolean includeIpV6)
        Get the most significant IP V4 or V6 address of the local host (TCP/IP). The most significant IP address is determined by the following order:
        1. First public IP V4 address
        2. First public IP V6 address
        3. First loopback IP V4 address
        4. First loopback IP V6 address
        Parameters:
        includeIpV6 - if not true return IP V4 addresses only
        Returns:
        the IP address of the local host, or an empty string if the IP address can not be determined
        Since:
        V5.4-I

      • isHeuristicHtmlContent

        public static boolean isHeuristicHtmlContent(byte[] decompressedContent)
        Checks if binary data contains HTML formatted content.
        Parameters:
        decompressedContent - binary input data (plain or already decompressed if applicable)
        Returns:
        true, if the binary data contains HTML formatted content

      • escapeXmlString

        public static java.lang.String escapeXmlString(java.lang.String s)
        Replace special characters with XML escapes.
         
        < (less than) is replaced by &lt;
        > (greater than) is replaced by &gt;
        " (double quote) is replaced by &quot;
        ' (single quote) is replaced by &apos;
        & (ampersand) is replaced by &amp;
        Parameters:
        s - the XML string to be escaped
        Returns:
        the escaped XML string
        See Also:
        unescapeXmlString(java.lang.String)

      • unescapeXmlString

        public static java.lang.String unescapeXmlString(java.lang.String s)
        Convert XML escapes back to normal characters.
         
        &lt; is replaced by < (less than)
        &gt; is replaced by > (greater than)
        &quot; is replaced by " (double quote)
        &apos; is replaced by ' (single quote) &amp; is replaced by & (ampersand)
        Parameters:
        s - the XML string to be unescaped
        Returns:
        the unescaped XML string
        See Also:
        escapeXmlString(java.lang.String)

                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Convert JSON data to XML.
        Parameters:
        jsonText - JSON text string
        Returns:
        XML data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • matchTextWithWildcards

        public static boolean matchTextWithWildcards(java.lang.String wildcardPatternString,
                             java.lang.String observeString)
        Check if a string containing one or multiple wildcards '*' (= placeholder for multiple chars) and '?' (= placeholder for a single char) match to an observe-string.
        Parameters:
        wildcardPatternString - a string containing one or multiple wildcard chars.
        observeString - the string to observe
        Returns:
        true if the string containing wildcard chars match to the observe-string

      • convertWildcardPatternStringToRegex

        public static java.lang.String convertWildcardPatternStringToRegex(java.lang.String wildcardPatternString)
        Convert a string containing one or multiple wildcards '*' (= placeholder for multiple chars) and '?' (= placeholder for a single char) to a regex expression that can be used as input argument to Pattern.compile(convertWildcardPatternStringToRegex(wildcardPatternString));
        Parameters:
        wildcardPatternString - a string containing one or multiple wildcard chars.
        Returns:
        input for Pattern.compile(String regex)
